error._secondary: This server does not support this type of authentication and may not support authentication at all.

error._primary: Your login to your server “{0}” as “{0}” failed.
error._secondary: Check to make sure your password is spelled correctly. Remember that many passwords are case sensitive; your caps lock might be on.

error._primary: Are you sure you want to send a message in HTML format?
error._secondary: Please make sure the following recipients are willing and able to receive HTML email: {0}

error._primary: Are you sure you want to send a message without a subject?
error._secondary: Adding a meaningful Subject line to your messages will give your recipients an idea of what your mail is about.

error._primary: Are you sure you want to send a message with only BCC recipients?
error._secondary:
The contact list you are sending to is configured to hide list recipients.
Many email systems add an Apparently-To header to messages that only have BCC recipients. This header, if added, will list all of your recipients in your message. To avoid this, you should add at least one To: or CC: recipient.

error._primary: Are you sure you want to send a message with only BCC recipients?
error._secondary: Many email systems add an Apparently-To header to messages that only have BCC recipients. This header, if added, will list all of your recipients to your message anyway. To avoid this, you should add at least one To: or CC: recipient.

error._primary: Are you sure you want to send a message with invalid address?
error._secondary: The following recipient was not recognized as a valid mail address: {0}

error._primary: Are you sure you want to send a message with invalid addresses?
error._secondary: The following recipients were not recognized as valid mail addresses: {0}
You are replying privately to a message which arrived via a mailing list, but the list is trying to redirect your reply to go back to the list. Are you sure you want to proceed?
You are replying to a message which arrived via a mailing list, but you are replying privately to the sender; not to the list. Are you sure you want to proceed?
You are replying to a message which was sent to many recipients. Are you sure you want to reply to ALL of them?

error._primary: This message cannot be sent because you have not specified any recipients
error._secondary: Please enter a valid email address in the To: field. You can search for email addresses by clicking on the To: button next to the entry box.

Unable to open the drafts folder for this account. Use the system drafts folder instead?

If you unsubscribe the folder, it might not be visible in the Evolution, while still being available on the server. You can re-subscribe in Folder→Subscriptions... menu.

error._primary: Really delete folder “{0}” and all of its subfolders?

error._secondary: If you delete the folder, all of its contents will be deleted permanently.

You must specify at least one folder as a source. Either by selecting the folders individually, and/or by selecting all local folders, all remote folders, or both.

A non-empty folder at “{1}” already exists.
You can choose to ignore this folder, overwrite or append its contents, or quit.

error._primary: Evolution’s local mail format has changed.
error._secondary:
Evolution’s local mail format has changed from mbox to Maildir. Your local mail must be migrated to the new format before Evolution can proceed. Do you want to migrate now?
An mbox account will be created to preserve the old mbox folders. You can delete the account after ensuring the data is safely migrated. Please make sure there is enough disk space if you choose to migrate now.
Cannot read the license file “{0}”, due to an installation problem. You will not be able to use this provider until you can accept its license.

error._secondary: A WebKitWebProcess crashed when displaying the signature. You can try again by moving to another signature and back. If the issue persists, please file a bug report in GNOME GitLab.

error._primary: Do you wish to import OpenPGP key?
Change sort order of the message list?
error._secondary: Click in the list headers usually changes sort order. Choose what to do.

error._primary: Send mail with Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) public key?
error._secondary:
The message contains your public PGP key, which the recipients can use to encrypt messages sent to you or to verify signatures made with this PGP key.
This option is set for each mail account separately. You can find it in the Security tab of the mail account Properties.
